question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure the code you provide is executable for demonstration. Develop a browser-based real-time video recording and editing tool that allows users to record video through their camera, perform basic editing (cutting, merging), add text and filters, preview editing effects in real-time, and export the recorded video.

checklist.title: Is the video recording functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code correctly implements the MediaStream API to access the user's camera, creates a robust MediaRecorder implementation for video capture, and handles permission requests gracefully. Score 0 if there's no video recording functionality, 5 if basic recording works but lacks error handling, and 10 if it includes proper permission handling, recording indicators, and fallback mechanisms for unsupported browsers.

checklist.title: Are the basic video editing features (cutting, merging) implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code properly implements video segment manipulation using techniques like Web Workers for processing or browser-native APIs. Check if it can accurately cut video at specified timestamps and merge multiple clips together. Deduct 5 points if the editing causes quality loss, 3 points if the editing operations aren't precise to the frame level, and 3 points if preview generation of edits is slow (>500ms). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is text overlay and filter application functionality effective?
checklist.description: Review the implementation of text overlays (including font selection, positioning, timing control) and filter effects (using CSS filters, WebGL, or canvas-based processing). Assess if text can be styled, positioned, and timed properly, and if filters are applied efficiently without significant performance degradation. Deduct 3 points if text positioning is imprecise, 3 points if filter previews aren't real-time, and 4 points if there's no keyframe support for text/filter timing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the solution provide real-time preview of all editing effects?
checklist.description: Check if the implementation provides immediate visual feedback for all editing operations without significant lag (<100ms delay). Verify that the preview accurately represents the final output and updates dynamically as users make changes. Deduct 5 points if the preview isn't representative of the final export, 5 points if there's noticeable lag (>250ms) when applying complex effects, and 3 points if the preview doesn't update automatically with edits. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as camera access denial, browser compatibility issues, memory limitations during processing, unexpected user interactions) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted automatic cutting 2. Audio visualization overlays 3. Motion tracking for text/effects 4. One-click social media optimization). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple filter systems coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to video editing (e.g., a built-in file manager) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive background animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating recording/editing/preview/export modules), memory management strategies for video processing, and error handling. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if memory leaks are found when handling large videos; deduct 5 points if there's no structured error handling. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during timeline scrubbing, and 5 points for difficult-to-access key editing tools. The full score is 10 points.
